## README.md Specific Instructions

### Converting README.md to PDF

1. Basic conversion:
```bash
npx md-to-pdf README.md
```

2. With custom styling:
```bash
npx md-to-pdf --stylesheet markdown.css README.md
```

3. With specific PDF options:
```bash
npx md-to-pdf \
  --stylesheet markdown.css \
  --pdf-options '{"format": "A4", "margin": "5mm 2mm"}' \
  README.md
```

### README.md Styling Tips

1. Headers:
```css
h1 { font-size: 24px; margin-bottom: 20px; }
h2 { font-size: 20px; margin-bottom: 15px; }
h3 { font-size: 18px; margin-bottom: 10px; }
```

2. Code blocks:
```css
pre {
  background-color: #f5f5f5;
  padding: 15px;
  border-radius: 5px;
  overflow-x: auto;
}
```

3. Lists:
```css
ul, ol {
  margin-left: 20px;
  margin-bottom: 15px;
}
```

4. Links:
```css
a {
  color: #0366d6;
  text-decoration: none;
}
a:hover {
  text-decoration: underline;
}
```

### Recommended README.md PDF Settings

```bash
npx md-to-pdf \
  --stylesheet markdown.css \
  --css "
    body { font-family: 'Arial', sans-serif; }
    h1 { font-size: 24px; margin-bottom: 20px; }
    h2 { font-size: 20px; margin-bottom: 15px; }
    pre { background-color: #f5f5f5; padding: 15px; }
  " \
  --pdf-options '{
    "format": "A4",
    "margin": "5mm 2mm",
    "printBackground": true
  }' \
  README.md
```

### Troubleshooting README.md Conversion

1. If images don't display:
   - Use absolute paths for images
   - Ensure images are accessible
   - Add `--basedir` option if needed

2. If code blocks are not formatted correctly:
   - Use `--highlight-style` option
   - Ensure proper markdown syntax
   - Check CSS for code block styling

3. If page breaks are not working:
   - Use `page-break-before: always` in CSS
   - Add `break-after: avoid` to prevent orphaned headings
   - Check PDF options for proper page size
